text: James Benson "Jim" Irwin (March 17, 1930 â€“ August 8, 1991) (Col, USAF) was an American astronaut and test pilot. He was the eighth person to walk on the Moon and the first, and youngest, of those astronauts to die. Irwin died of a heart attack while riding his bike in Glenwood Springs, Colorado on August 8, 1991 at the age of 61. ==References== Category:1930 births Category:1991 deaths Category:American astronauts Category:American Evangelicals Category:Creationists Category:Deaths from myocardial infarction Category:Scientists from Pittsburgh
title: James Irwin
